author: john.jackson
title: CardanoHTX
description: 休斯顿和德克萨斯州是拥有区块链社区的主要经济体，但面向卡达诺的开发者之间缺乏网络。

f6_assessments.q0:
我认为我有能力评估这个提案，因为我从第4个基金开始就一直活跃在 "催化剂 "项目中，而且我有超过5年的为小型企业和公司提供软件解决方案的经验，可以分析业务需求。
问题陈述的表述很清楚，也很容易理解。更多的网络化将有利于生态系统，这可能是真的。
解决方案似乎并不完整，它只说 "从非正式会议开始"。然而，从建议的其余部分，可以推断出建议的解决方案是在休斯顿组织会议并在那里建立一个Cardano中心。今后尽量注意将解决方案添加到提案中，因为从一开始就抓住选民的注意力很重要。他们必须在阅读的前几句话中看到质量。
这个计划对我来说很有意义。德州，特别是休斯顿似乎确实正在变成一个商业中心，甚至有可能在技术方面很强大，特别是自从埃隆-马斯克、乔-罗根和其他大人物开始搬到那里之后。试图在那里建立一个Cardano社区似乎是一个非常好的主意。为提议者点赞。他们也很好地概述了将会给Cardano带来的好处。将Plutus介绍给那里的人群可能会给我们带来巨大的潜力。
我发现该提案的目标是雄心勃勃的，但也是合理的，还有衡量标准（在资助后的3个月内举行2次会议，有50个独立访客，听起来非常可行）。如果我可以提出一个建议，也许为社会媒体的追随者设定一个目标也是一个好主意，这样我们也可以跟踪它。尽管不幸的是，解决方案并没有明确制定，但我相信这是一个很好的想法，有一个很好的行动计划，我强烈同意它有效地解决了 "扩大Cardano社区中心 "的挑战。
f6_assessments.q1:
我很遗憾地说，该提案在这一类别中没有达到要求。提案人只提到他们曾在为特定利益群体服务的组织中担任过领导职务。选民会想知道你到底是谁，你做了什么，所以如果能在这里添加一些证书就更好了。一个LinkedIn页面，一个Youtube频道，甚至是一个Twitter或Facebook账户，都会在很大程度上让人一目了然，并向人们展示谁会在这方面工作。另外，如果能了解到你指的是什么组织，你在那里的职责是什么，那就更好了。
在我看来，预算是非常合理的，而且也是以一种可理解的方式分解的。我认为这里还可以增加一个内容，就是解决可能的风险的部分。这表明选民你在规划时真的很认真。例如，如果在接下来的几个月里实施了新的封锁，会发生什么？一个可能的解决方案是在Zoom上举行会议，或者在现场举行会议，但人数较少等。
由于这里缺乏个人资历，以及缺少风险分析，我只能在 "该提案极有可能成功实施 "部分给3颗星。我本想给更多，但这是缺少的关键数据。
f6_assessments.q2: 在我看来，这份提案在它想做的事情上是相当明确的，它所提供的路线图以及关键绩效指标也是令人满意的。提案人不仅为3-6个月设定了现实的目标，而且还表明他们有远见，希望在12个月后再获得一次资助，并进一步扩大这一举措。我认为它在清晰度/可审计性方面值得给4颗星。缺少一星是因为解决方案在开始时没有被清楚地概述，而且提案中有点缺乏关于提案人本身的信息。希望在下一篇中，我们能看到这些内容。祝你好运，我希望看到这种情况的发生!

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal seeks to create a foothold in Houston, TX. Considering the proportions of economy Texas holds and an already established presence of blockchain as a whole, it could prove fruitious to, and I believe this is key here, 'Identify future opportunities to establish a permanent footprint'. So for the requested amount, this can be viewed as a prospecting venture open to analysis at a later time.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is a pilot lasting for a 6-month period to determine if there is an opportunity to expand on this. What I did not see in the proposal is where the visitors would come from. Are you aiming for students or general public? Where will you advertise and how? Some additional information on the identity and organisational skills of the proposer could improve this proposal in terms of feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a roadmap, budget breakdown and KPIs present in the proposal. To improve the proposal, try adding some background information on the proposer and insight in how the meetings would get marketed.

f6_assessments.q0:
Establishing a cardano HUB in Houston is in accordance with the challenge goal. 

Its efficiency to output/budget is great.

The question arises - where these meetings will be held? online? since there are costs for beverages I expect it will be in person = you need to rent a space, or this space will be for free? This requires more details.

Rating given 4.
f6_assessments.q1:
The experience posted seems not to be in perfect accordance, so it is hard to tell whether he can deliver the final output. 

Also, some linked in profile would be nice to see and maybe establish a team. Right now, it will be a one-man job where the likelihood of success is speculative. 

On the other hand, some objectives seem reasonable and achievable. 

Rating given 3.
f6_assessments.q2:
The budget is divided into different categories, seems reasonable.

Metrics are also provided which can be audited.

Rating given 5.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to increase awareness and adoption of Cardano among Houston and Texas communities, so it is aligned with the challenge's goal. Given the recent actions taken by Texas towards promoting blockchain initiatives in the state, it is a major opportunity to give Cardano a spotlight in this new scenario. Reaching more people and businesses would certainly add value to the Cardano ecosystem. However, the final objective of having 200 members by the end of the year could be more ambitious, as it does not explore the full potential on this new blockchain capital. Perhaps, setting up more monthly meetings in different locations across Texas could improve the reaching potential.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is very brief about his relevant experience. Having held leadership roles in organizations should make him fit for setting up this hub, but it is vague concerning which areas of the organizations he was leader in, which industries those organizations were operating on and which specific communities of interest they were serving. Besides that, there were no words regarding neither which skills he has that could help him implementing this proposal, nor which skills would be needed. In the same way, he also does not specify the type and number of team members required to accomplish his goals. The budget is spectulative and does not detail what the coordination means, how the marketing would be done, what is the platform that he wants to set up and if there would be rent costs for the meeting places. The implementation plan could have more details about how each step is going to be done, such as which social medias would be used and which kind of content would be published, what kind of spaces the meetings would be held in, how he expects to attract people, encourage ambassadors and the timeline for those steps. On the other hand, the proposer indentifies as a teacher and proposes to include classes to the hub activities. That could be a powerful way to increase reaching with the average non-technical people, which is a key point in this challenge. Adding the details mentioned will certainly increase this proposal attractiveness.
f6_assessments.q2: There is not a clear roadmap, as the steps are not detailed on how to be executed. There should be a specific deadline for each step. The milestones include number of meetings and number of visitors and members, which are tangible KPIs to quantify the success of the project. A more detailed roadmap with specific deadlines will give the needed auditability.
